item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by A.A. Milne
Donabilla add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones." -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Donabilla add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?" -- Mark Twain
